alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 9:02PM CST until February 18 at 9:30PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROCK ISLAND...NORTHERN MERCER...NORTHEASTERN HENRY... LOUISA...SOUTHWESTERN CEDAR...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON...EASTERN WASHINGTON AND MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 902 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Walcott to 6 miles north of Ainsworth, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 264 and 272. Locations impacted include... Muscatine, Aledo, Wapello, Columbus Junction, West Liberty, Wilton, Lone Tree, Winfield, Riverside, Fruitland, Viola, Millersburg, Matherville, Hills, New Boston, Sherrard, Ainsworth, Grandview, Reynolds and Conesville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
